title: Japanese apparel firms give new life to their old clothes
summary: Japanese fashion companies are increasingly focusing on reducing waste by selling secondhand clothing. Sanyo Shokai is selling used items that meet its quality standards after checking and ironing them, while Uniqlo is reselling used clothes at low prices or after redying them. These initiatives aim to contribute to the circular economy by reusing and repurposing clothes.
